author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Parks Walks it Off; 7-6 Victory over Dayton
text:
Parks Walks it Off; 7-6 Victory over Dayton
The Miami University softball team secured a thrilling 7-6 win over the University of Dayton, highlighted by Chloe Parks' walk-off double in the seventh inning. With this victory, the RedHawks improved to a 13-15 season record, maintaining a perfect 3-0 in the Mid-American Conference (MAC). The Flyers, meanwhile, dropped to 12-10, also at 3-0 in the Atlantic 10 (A-10).
- Chloe Parks went 3-for-4 at the plate and had 4 RBIs.
- Mckenna Campbell was 3-for-3 with 2 runs scored.
- Miami had a lead of 6-0 midway through the game.
Despite their strong start, Miami allowed Dayton to tie the game, showcasing concerns about maintaining leads late in games. This aspect could be critical as they move into tougher matchups.
State of Play- The RedHawks have now won three consecutive games in the MAC.
- Both teams displayed powerful offenses, with Miami initially dominating before Dayton rallied.
The RedHawks will face Northern Illinois University for a three-game series starting Friday, March 21. Maintaining momentum will be crucial for Miami in this upcoming series.
Bottom LineThe dramatic walk-off victory reflects both the resilience and vulnerabilities of Miami's softball team. Strengthening their late-game defense will be key as they look to capitalize on their current winning streak.
Read more at Miami University RedHawks
